intro: Lepidadenia fuscescens, commonly known as the black lepidadenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are usually covered in a fine, whitish pubescence. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have a yellowish-green corolla with prominent stamens. Lepidadenia fuscescens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, arid environments.
